1.verse_text: How blessed is the one who does not follow the advice of the wicked, or stand in the pathway with sinners, or sit in the assembly of scoffers! he meditates on his commands day and night. it yields its fruit at the proper time, and its leaves never fall off. He succeeds in everything he attempts. Instead they are like wind-driven chaff. nor can sinners join the assembly of the godly. but the way of the wicked ends in destruction.
Instead he finds pleasure in obeying the Lord "s commands;
He is like a tree planted by flowing streams;
For this reason the wicked cannot withstand judgment,
Certainly the Lord guards the way of the godly,

2.verse_text: Why do the nations rebel? Why are the countries devising plots that will fail? the rulers collaborate against the Lord and his anointed king. Let"s free ourselves from their ropes!' the Lord taunts them. and terrifies them in his rage, saying, "You are my son! This very day I have become your father! and I will give you the nations as your inheritance, you will smash them like a potter"s jar!"' you rulers of the earth, submit to correction! Repent in terror! Otherwise he will be angry, and you will die because of your behavior, when his anger quickly ignites. How blessed are all who take shelter in him!
The kings of the earth form a united front;
They say, 'Let"s tear off the shackles they"ve put on us!
The one enthroned in heaven laughs in disgust;
Then he angrily speaks to them
'I myself have installed my king on Zion, my holy hill.' the ends of the earth as your personal property.
The king says, 'I will announce the Lord"s decree. He said to me:
You will break them with an iron scepter;
So now, you kings, do what is wise;

3.verse_text: Lord , how numerous are my enemies! Many attack me. 'God will not deliver him.' (Selah) you are my glory and the one who restores me. and he answered me from his holy hill. (Selah) I awoke, for the Lord protects me. who attack me from all directions. Yes, you will strike all my enemies on the jaw; you will break the teeth of the wicked. you show favor to your people. (Selah)
But you, Lord , are a shield that protects me;
To the Lord I cried out,
I am not afraid of the multitude of people
Rise up, Lord ! Deliver me, my God!

4.verse_text: When I call out, answer me, O God who vindicates me! Though I am hemmed in, you will lead me into a wide, open place. Have mercy on me and respond to my prayer! How long will you love what is worthless and search for what is deceptive? (Selah) the Lord responds when I cry out to him. Meditate as you lie in bed, and repent of your ways! (Selah) and trust in the Lord ! Smile upon us, Lord ! than those who have abundant grain and wine. for you, Lord , make me safe and secure.
You men, how long will you try to turn my honor into shame?
Realize that the Lord shows the godly special favor;
Tremble with fear and do not sin!
Many say, 'Who can show us anything good?'
I will lie down and sleep peacefully,

5.verse_text: Listen to what I say, Lord ! Carefully consider my complaint! in the morning I will present my case to you and then wait expectantly for an answer. evil people cannot dwell with you. you hate all who behave wickedly. the Lord despises violent and deceitful people. I will bow down toward your holy temple as I worship you. because of those who wait to ambush me, remove the obstacles in the way in which you are guiding me! their stomachs are like the place of destruction, their throats like an open grave, their tongues like a steep slope leading into it. May their own schemes be their downfall! Drive them away because of their many acts of insurrection, May they continually shout for joy! Shelter them so that those who are loyal to you may rejoice! Like a shield you protect them in your good favor.
Pay attention to my cry for help, my king and my God, for I am praying to you! for they have rebelled against you.
Lord , in the morning you will hear me;
Certainly you are not a God who approves of evil;
Arrogant people cannot stand in your presence;
But as for me, because of your great faithfulness I will enter your house;
Lord , lead me in your righteousness
For they do not speak the truth;
But may all who take shelter in you be happy!
Certainly you reward the godly, Lord .

6.verse_text: Lord , do not rebuke me in your anger! Do not discipline me in your raging fury! Heal me, Lord , for my bones are shaking! and you, Lord – how long will this continue? Deliver me because of your faithfulness! In Sheol who gives you thanks? all night long I drench my bed in tears; my tears saturate the cushion beneath me. they grow weak because of all my enemies. for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping! the Lord has accepted my prayer.
Have mercy on me, Lord , for I am frail!
For no one remembers you in the realm of death,
I am exhausted as I groan;
My eyes grow dim from suffering;
Turn back from me, all you who behave wickedly,
The Lord has heard my appeal for mercy;
May all my enemies be humiliated and absolutely terrified! May they turn back and be suddenly humiliated!

7.verse_text: O Lord my God, in you I have taken shelter. Deliver me from all who chase me! Rescue me! O righteous God, who conceives destructive plans,

Otherwise they will rip me to shreds like a lion; they will tear me to bits and no one will be able to rescue me. or am guilty of unjust actions, or helped his lawless enemy, may he trample me to death and leave me lying dishonored in the dust. (Selah) Rise up with raging fury against my enemies! Wake up for my sake and execute the judgment you have decreed for them! take once more your rightful place over them! Vindicate me, Lord , because I am innocent, because I am blameless, O Exalted One! But make the innocent secure, you who examine inner thoughts and motives! the one who delivers the morally upright. he is angry throughout the day. and prepares to shoot his bow. he gets ready to shoot flaming arrows. and gives birth to harmful lies – and then falls into the hole he has made. and the violence he intended for others falls on his own head. I will sing praises to the sovereign Lord !
O Lord my God, if I have done what they say,
may an enemy relentlessly chase me and catch me;
The countries are assembled all around you;
May the evil deeds of the wicked come to an end!
The Exalted God is my shield,
If a person does not repent, God sharpens his sword
He prepares to use deadly weapons against him;
See the one who is pregnant with wickedness,
He becomes the victim of his own destructive plans
I will thank the Lord for his justice;

8.verse_text: O Lord , our Lord, how magnificent is your reputation throughout the earth! You reveal your majesty in the heavens above! you have ordained praise on account of your adversaries, so that you might put an end to the vindictive enemy. and see the moon and the stars, which you set in place, Of what importance is mankind, that you should pay attention to them, You grant mankind honor and majesty; you have placed everything under their authority, as well as the wild animals, and everything that moves through the currents of the seas. how magnificent is your reputation throughout the earth!
From the mouths of children and nursing babies
When I look up at the heavens, which your fingers made,
Of what importance is the human race, that you should notice them?
and make them a little less than the heavenly beings?
you appoint them to rule over your creation;
including all the sheep and cattle,
the birds in the sky, the fish in the sea

9.verse_text: I will thank the Lord with all my heart! I will tell about all your amazing deeds! I will sing praises to you, O sovereign One! they trip and are defeated before you. from your throne you pronounced a just decision. you destroyed the wicked; you permanently wiped out all memory of them. you destroyed their cities; all memory of the enemies has perished. he reigns in a just manner. he makes just legal decisions for the nations. he provides safety in times of trouble. for you, Lord , do not abandon those who seek your help. Tell the nations what he has done! he did not overlook their cry for help 'Have mercy on me, Lord ! See how I am oppressed by those who hate me, O one who can snatch me away from the gates of death! in the gates of Daughter Zion I will rejoice because of your deliverance.' their feet were caught in the net they had hidden. the wicked were ensnared by their own actions. (Higgaion. Selah) this is the destiny of all the nations that ignore God, the hopes of the oppressed are not forever dashed. Don"t let men be defiant! Let the nations know they are mere mortals! (Selah)
I will be happy and rejoice in you!
When my enemies turn back,
For you defended my just cause;
You terrified the nations with your battle cry;
The enemy"s cities have been reduced to permanent ruins;
But the Lord rules forever;
He judges the world fairly;
Consequently the Lord provides safety for the oppressed;
Your loyal followers trust in you,
Sing praises to the Lord , who rules in Zion!
For the one who takes revenge against murderers took notice of the oppressed;
when they prayed:
Then I will tell about all your praiseworthy acts;
The nations fell into the pit they had made;
The Lord revealed himself; he accomplished justice; May the nations be judged in your presence!
The wicked are turned back and sent to Sheol;
for the needy are not permanently ignored,
Rise up, Lord !
Terrify them, Lord !

10.verse_text: Why, Lord , do you stand far off? Why do you pay no attention during times of trouble? the oppressed are trapped by the schemes the wicked have dreamed up. the one who robs others curses and rejects the Lord . 'God won"t hold me accountable; he doesn"t care.' He has no regard for your commands; he disdains all his enemies. 'I will never be upended, because I experience no calamity.' his tongue injures and destroys. His eyes look for some unfortunate victim. he lies in ambush, waiting to catch the oppressed; he catches the oppressed by pulling in his net. they are trapped in his sturdy nets. he never notices.' O God, strike him down! He says to himself, 'You will not hold me accountable.' for you always see one who inflicts pain and suffering. The unfortunate victim entrusts his cause to you; you deliver the fatherless. Hold him accountable for his wicked deeds, which he thought you would not discover. The nations are driven out of his land. you make them feel secure because you listen to their prayer. so that mere mortals may no longer terrorize them.
The wicked arrogantly chase the oppressed;
Yes, the wicked man boasts because he gets what he wants;
The wicked man is so arrogant he always thinks,
He is secure at all times.
His mouth is full of curses and deceptive, harmful words;
He waits in ambush near the villages; in hidden places he kills the innocent. 'God overlooks it; he does not pay attention; Do not forget the oppressed!
He lies in ambush in a hidden place, like a lion in a thicket;
His victims are crushed and beaten down;
Why does the wicked man reject God?
Break the arm of the wicked and evil man!
Lord , you have heard the request of the oppressed;
You defend the fatherless and oppressed,

11.verse_text: In the Lord I have taken shelter. How can you say to me, 'Flee to a mountain like a bird! to shoot in the darkness at the morally upright. what can the godly accomplish?' the Lord "s throne is in heaven. His eyes watch; his eyes examine all people. but he hates the wicked and those who love to do violence. A whirlwind is what they deserve! he rewards godly deeds; the upright will experience his favor.
For look, the wicked prepare their bows, they put their arrows on the strings,
The Lord is in his holy temple;
The Lord approves of the godly,
May the Lord rain down burning coals and brimstone on the wicked!

12.verse_text: Deliver, Lord ! For the godly have disappeared; people of integrity have vanished. they flatter and deceive. and the tongue that boasts! we know how to flatter and boast. Who is our master?' because of the painful cries of the needy, I will spring into action,' says the Lord . 'I will provide the safety they so desperately desire.' where it is thoroughly refined. you will continually shelter each one from these evil people, when people promote evil.
May the Lord cut off all flattering lips,
'Because of the violence done to the oppressed,
The Lord "s words are absolutely reliable. They are as untainted as silver purified in a furnace on the ground,
for the wicked seem to be everywhere,

13.verse_text: How long, Lord , will you continue to ignore me? How long will you pay no attention to me? and suffer in broad daylight? How long will my enemy gloat over me? Revive me, or else I will die! Then my foes will rejoice because I am upended. May I rejoice because of your deliverance! when he vindicates me.
Look at me! Answer me, O Lord my God!
Then my enemy will say, 'I have defeated him!'
But I trust in your faithfulness.
I will sing praises to the Lord

14.verse_text: Fools say to themselves, 'There is no God.' They sin and commit evil deeds; none of them does what is right. to see if there is anyone who is wise and seeks God. they are all morally corrupt. None of them does what is right, for God defends the godly. even though the Lord is their shelter. When the Lord restores the well-being of his people, may Jacob rejoice, may Israel be happy!
The Lord looks down from heaven at the human race,
Everyone rejects God; not even one! those who devour my people as if they were eating bread, and do not call out to the Lord .
All those who behave wickedly do not understand –
You want to humiliate the oppressed,
I wish the deliverance of Israel would come from Zion!

15.verse_text: Lord , who may be a guest in your home? Who may live on your holy hill? and speaks honestly. or do harm to others, or insult his neighbor. but honors the Lord "s loyal followers. He makes firm commitments and does not renege on his promise. He does not take bribes to testify against the innocent. The one who lives like this will never be upended.
Whoever lives a blameless life, does what is right,
He does not charge interest when he lends his money.

16.verse_text: Protect me, O God, for I have taken shelter in you.

I say to the Lord , 'You are the Lord, my only source of well-being.' and the leading officials I admired so much – they desire other gods. I will not pour out drink offerings of blood to their gods, nor will I make vows in the name of their gods. you make my future secure. or received a beautiful tract of land. yes, during the night I reflect and learn. and I am happy; My life is safe. you will not allow your faithful follower to see the Pit. I experience absolute joy in your presence; you always give me sheer delight.
As for God"s chosen people who are in the land,
Lord , you give me stability and prosperity;
It is as if I have been given fertile fields
I will praise the Lord who guides me;
I constantly trust in the Lord ; because he is at my right hand, I will not be upended.
You will not abandon me to Sheol;
You lead me in the path of life;

17.verse_text: Lord , consider my just cause! Pay attention to my cry for help! Listen to the prayer You have carefully evaluated me, but you find no sin. just as you have commanded, They have many children, I sincerely offer! Decide what is right! you have examined me during the night. I am determined I will say nothing sinful. I have not followed in the footsteps of violent men. I do not deviate from them. Listen to me! Hear what I say! you who powerfully deliver those who look to you for protection from their enemies. Hide me in the shadow of your wings! my enemies who crowd around me for the kill. they speak arrogantly. they intend to throw me to the ground. like a young lion crouching in hidden places. Confront him! Knock him down! Use your sword to rescue me from the wicked man! from the murderers of this world! They enjoy prosperity; you overwhelm them with the riches they desire. and leave their wealth to their offspring. when I awake you will reveal yourself to me.
Make a just decision on my behalf!
You have scrutinized my inner motives;
As for the actions of people –
I call to you for you will answer me, O God.
Protect me as you would protect the pupil of your eye!
Protect me from the wicked men who attack me,
They attack me, now they surround me;
He is like a lion that wants to tear its prey to bits,
Lord , use your power to deliver me from these murderers,
As for me, because I am innocent I will see your face;

18.verse_text: He said: 'I love you, Lord , my source of strength! My God is my rocky summit where I take shelter, my shield, the horn that saves me, and my refuge. the currents of chaos overwhelmed me. the snares of death trapped me. I cried out to my God. From his heavenly temple he heard my voice; he listened to my cry for help. the roots of the mountains trembled; fire devoured as it came from his mouth; he hurled down fiery coals. he glided on the wings of the wind. in thick rain clouds. hail and fiery coals. the sovereign One shouted. many lightning bolts and routed them. the inner regions of the world were uncovered by your battle cry, Lord , by the powerful breath from your nose. he pulled me from the surging water. but the Lord helped me. he delivered me because he was pleased with me. he rewarded my blameless behavior. I have not rebelled against my God. and I do not reject his rules. and kept myself from sinning. he took notice of my blameless behavior. you prove to be trustworthy to one who is innocent. but you prove to be deceptive to one who is perverse. but you bring down those who have a proud look. My God illuminates the darkness around me. by my God"s power I can jump over a wall. the Lord "s promise is reliable; he is a shield to all who take shelter in him. Who is a protector besides our God? he removes the obstacles in my way. he enables me to negotiate the rugged terrain. my arms can bend even the strongest bow. your right hand supports me; your willingness to help enables me to prevail. my feet do not slip. they fall at my feet. you make my foes kneel before me. I destroy those who hate me. they cry out to the Lord , but he does not answer them. I beat them underfoot like clay in the streets. you make me a leader of nations; people over whom I had no authority are now my subjects. Foreigners are powerless before me; they shake with fear as they leave their strongholds. My protector is praiseworthy! The God who delivers me is exalted as king! he makes nations submit to me. you snatch me away from those who attack me; I will sing praises to you! he is faithful to his chosen ruler, to David and his descendants forever.'
The Lord is my high ridge, my stronghold, my deliverer.

I called to the Lord , who is worthy of praise, and I was delivered from my enemies. they heaved because he was angry. a thick cloud was under his feet. from those who hate me, for they were too strong for me. I do not turn back until I wipe them out. you rescue me from violent men.
The waves of death engulfed me,
The ropes of Sheol tightened around me,
In my distress I called to the Lord ;
The earth heaved and shook;
Smoke ascended from his nose;
He made the sky sink as he descended;
He mounted a winged angel and flew;
He shrouded himself in darkness,
From the brightness in front of him came
The Lord thundered in the sky;
He shot his arrows and scattered them,
The depths of the sea were exposed;
He reached down from above and took hold of me;
He rescued me from my strong enemy,
They confronted me in my day of calamity,
He brought me out into a wide open place;
The Lord repaid me for my godly deeds;
For I have obeyed the Lord "s commands;
For I am aware of all his regulations,
I was innocent before him,
The Lord rewarded me for my godly deeds;
You prove to be loyal to one who is faithful;
You prove to be reliable to one who is blameless,
For you deliver oppressed people,
Indeed, you are my lamp, Lord .
Indeed, with your help I can charge against an army;
The one true God acts in a faithful manner;
Indeed, who is God besides the Lord ?
The one true God gives me strength;
He gives me the agility of a deer;
He trains my hands for battle;
You give me your protective shield;
You widen my path;
I chase my enemies and catch them;
I beat them to death;
You give me strength for battle;
You make my enemies retreat;
They cry out, but there is no one to help them;
I grind them as fine windblown dust;
You rescue me from a hostile army;
When they hear of my exploits, they submit to me.
foreigners lose their courage;
The Lord is alive!
The one true God completely vindicates me;
He delivers me from my enemies;
So I will give you thanks before the nations, O Lord !
He gives his chosen king magnificent victories;

19.verse_text: The heavens declare the glory of God; the sky displays his handiwork. night after night it reveals his greatness. nor is its voice literally heard. its words carry to the distant horizon. In the sky he has pitched a tent for the sun. like a strong man it enjoys running its course. and goes from one end of the sky to the other; nothing can escape its heat. and preserves one"s life. The rules set down by the Lord are reliable and impart wisdom to the inexperienced. and make one joyful. The Lord "s commands are pure and give insight for life. and endure forever. and absolutely just. they bring greater delight than honey, those who obey them receive a rich reward. Please do not punish me for sins I am unaware of. do not allow such sins to control me. and innocent of blatant rebellion. be acceptable in your sight, O Lord , my sheltering rock and my redeemer.
Day after day it speaks out;
There is no actual speech or word,
Yet its voice echoes throughout the earth;
Like a bridegroom it emerges from its chamber;
It emerges from the distant horizon,
The law of the Lord is perfect
The commands to fear the Lord are right The judgments given by the Lord are trustworthy than even a great amount of pure gold; than even the sweetest honey from a honeycomb. Then I will be blameless,
They are of greater value than gold,
Yes, your servant finds moral guidance there;
Who can know all his errors?
Moreover, keep me from committing flagrant sins;
May my words and my thoughts

20.verse_text: May the Lord answer you when you are in trouble; may the God of Jacob make you secure! may he accept your burnt sacrifice! (Selah) may he bring all your plans to pass! we will rejoice in the name of our God! he will intervene for him from his holy heavenly temple, and display his mighty ability to deliver. but we depend on the Lord our God. but we will stand firm. he will answer us when we call to him for help!
May he send you help from his temple; from Zion may he give you support! May the Lord grant all your requests!
May he take notice of your offerings;
May he grant your heart"s desire;
Then we will shout for joy over your victory;
Now I am sure that the Lord will deliver his chosen king;
Some trust in chariots and others in horses,
The Lord will deliver the king;

21.verse_text: O Lord , the king rejoices in the strength you give; he takes great delight in the deliverance you provide. you do not refuse his request. (Selah) and you have granted him long life and an enduring dynasty. you give him majestic splendor. you give him great joy by allowing him into your presence. and because of the sovereign Lord "s faithfulness he is not upended. your power is too great for those who hate you. the Lord angrily devours them; their descendants from among the human race. they dream up a scheme, but they do not succeed. when you shoot your arrows at them. We will sing and praise your power!
You grant him his heart"s desire;
For you bring him rich blessings; you place a golden crown on his head. the fire consumes them.
He asked you to sustain his life,
Your deliverance brings him great honor;
For you grant him lasting blessings;
For the king trusts in the Lord ,
You prevail over all your enemies;
You burn them up like a fiery furnace when you appear;
You destroy their offspring from the earth,
Yes, they intend to do you harm;
Rise up, O Lord , in strength!

22.verse_text: My God, my God, why have you abandoned me? I groan in prayer, but help seems far away. and during the night my prayers do not let up. you sit as king receiving the praises of Israel. they trusted in you and you rescued them. in you they trusted and they were not disappointed. people insult me and despise me. they mock me and shake their heads. 'Commit yourself to the Lord ! Let the Lord rescue him! Let the Lord deliver him, for he delights in him.' from the time I came out of my mother"s womb you have been my God. for trouble is near and I have no one to help me. powerful bulls of Bashan hem me in. like a roaring lion that rips its prey. my heart is like wax; my tongue sticks to my gums. You set me in the dust of death. like a lion they pin my hands and feet. my enemies are gloating over me in triumph. they are rolling dice for my garments. You are my source of strength! Hurry and help me! Save my life from the claws of the wild dogs! and from the horns of the wild oxen! You have answered me! All you descendants of Israel, stand in awe of him! he did not ignore him; when he cried out to him, he responded. I will fulfill my promises before the Lord "s loyal followers. May you live forever! Let all the nations worship you! all those who are descending into the grave will bow before him, including those who cannot preserve their lives. they will tell the next generation about the sovereign Lord. they will tell a future generation what he has accomplished.

My God, I cry out during the day, but you do not answer, and made me feel secure on my mother"s breasts. all my bones are dislocated; it melts away inside me. a gang of evil men crowd around me; In the middle of the assembly I will praise you! All you descendants of Jacob, honor him! Let those who seek his help praise the Lord ! and rules over the nations.
You are holy;
In you our ancestors trusted;
To you they cried out, and they were saved;
But I am a worm, not a man;
All who see me taunt me;
They say,
Yes, you are the one who brought me out from the womb
I have been dependent on you since birth;
Do not remain far away from me,
Many bulls surround me;
They open their mouths to devour me
My strength drains away like water;
The roof of my mouth is as dry as a piece of pottery;
Yes, wild dogs surround me –
I can count all my bones;
They are dividing up my clothes among themselves;
But you, O Lord , do not remain far away!
Deliver me from the sword!
Rescue me from the mouth of the lion,
I will declare your name to my countrymen!
You loyal followers of the Lord , praise him!
For he did not despise or detest the suffering of the oppressed;
You are the reason I offer praise in the great assembly;
Let the oppressed eat and be filled!
Let all the people of the earth acknowledge the Lord and turn to him!
For the Lord is king
All of the thriving people of the earth will join the celebration and worship;
A whole generation will serve him;
They will come and tell about his saving deeds;

23.verse_text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing. he leads me to refreshing water. He leads me down the right paths for the sake of his reputation. I fear no danger, for you are with me; in plain sight of my enemies.
He takes me to lush pastures,

Even when I must walk through the darkest valley, your rod and your staff reassure me. You refresh my head with oil; my cup is completely full. and I will live in the Lord "s house for the rest of my life.
You prepare a feast before me
Surely your goodness and faithfulness will pursue me all my days,

24.verse_text: The Lord owns the earth and all it contains, the world and all who live in it. Who may go up to his holy dwelling place? The Lord who is strong and mighty! The Lord who is mighty in battle! Rise up, you eternal doors! Then the majestic king will enter! He is the majestic king! (Selah)

For he set its foundation upon the seas, and established it upon the ocean currents. and whose motives are pure, who does not lie, or make promises with no intention of keeping them. and vindicated by the God who delivers them. Jacob"s descendants, who pray to him. (Selah) Rise up, you eternal doors! Then the majestic king will enter! The Lord who commands armies!
Who is allowed to ascend the mountain of the Lord ?
The one whose deeds are blameless
Such godly people are rewarded by the Lord ,
Such purity characterizes the people who seek his favor,

25.verse_text: O Lord , I come before you in prayer.

My God, I trust in you. Please do not let me be humiliated; do not let my enemies triumphantly rejoice over me! For you are the God who delivers me; on you I rely all day long. Please do not let me be humiliated, for I have taken shelter in you! for I rely on you!

Certainly none who rely on you will be humiliated. Those who deal in treachery will be thwarted and humiliated. Teach me your paths! for you have always acted in this manner. Because you are faithful to me, extend to me your favor, O Lord ! that is why he teaches sinners the right way to live. May he teach the humble his way! to those who follow the demands of his covenant. forgive my sin, because it is great. the way they should live. their descendants inherit the land. and he reveals his covenantal demands to them. for he will free my feet from the enemy"s net. for I am alone and oppressed! rescue me from my suffering! Forgive all my sins! they hate me and want to harm me. from all their distress!
Make me understand your ways, O Lord !
Guide me into your truth and teach me.
Remember your compassionate and faithful deeds, O Lord ,
Do not hold against me the sins of my youth or my rebellious acts!
The Lord is both kind and fair;
May he show the humble what is right!
The Lord always proves faithful and reliable
For the sake of your reputation, O Lord ,
The Lord shows his faithful followers
They experience his favor;
The Lord "s loyal followers receive his guidance,
I continually look to the Lord for help,
Turn toward me and have mercy on me,
Deliver me from my distress;
See my pain and suffering!
Watch my enemies, for they outnumber me;
Protect me and deliver me!
May integrity and godliness protect me,
O God, rescue Israel

26.verse_text: Vindicate me, O Lord , for I have integrity, Evaluate my inner thoughts and motives! and your loyalty continually motivates me. or consort with those who are dishonest. and do not associate with the wicked. so I can appear before your altar, O Lord , and to tell about all your amazing deeds. the place where your splendor is revealed. or execute me along with violent people, or offer a bribe. Rescue me and have mercy on me! and I trust in the Lord without wavering. and among the worshipers I will praise the Lord .
Examine me, O Lord , and test me!
For I am ever aware of your faithfulness,
I do not associate with deceitful men,
I hate the mob of evil men,
O Lord , I love the temple where you live,
Do not sweep me away with sinners,
who are always ready to do wrong

27.verse_text: The Lord delivers and vindicates me! I fear no one! I am afraid of no one! to devour my flesh, when my adversaries and enemies attack me, they stumble and fall. I do not fear. Even when war is imminent, I remain confident. I want to live in the Lord "s house all the days of my life, so I can gaze at the splendor of the Lord he will hide me in his home; he will place me on an inaccessible rocky summit. over my enemies who surround me! I will offer sacrifices in his dwelling place and shout for joy! and I do pray to you, O Lord . 44.verse_text: O God, we have clearly heard; our ancestors have told us what you did in their days, in ancient times. you crushed the people living there and enabled our ancestors to occupy it. and they did not prevail by their strength, but rather by your power, strength and good favor, for you were partial to them. Decree Jacob"s deliverance! by your strength we will trample down our foes! you humiliate those who hate us. You did not go into battle with our armies. Those who hate us take whatever they want from us. you did not ask a high price for them. those who live on our borders taunt and insult us. foreigners treat us with contempt. and am overwhelmed with shame, who ridicules and insults me. or violated your covenant with us. nor have we disobeyed your commands. you have covered us with darkness. and spread out our hands in prayer to another god, for he knows one"s thoughts? we are treated like sheep at the slaughtering block. For you deliver us from our enemies;
In God I boast all day long,
But you rejected and embarrassed us!
You made us retreat from the enemy.
You handed us over like sheep to be eaten;

before the vindictive enemy

would not God discover it,

For this reason God, your God has anointed you with the oil of joy, elevating you above your companions. From the luxurious palaces comes the music of stringed instruments that makes you happy. your bride stands at your right hand, wearing jewelry made with gold from Ophir. Observe and pay attention! I will proclaim your greatness through the coming years,

46.verse_text: God is our strong refuge; he is truly our helper in times of trouble. and the mountains tumble into the depths of the sea, and the mountains shake before the surging sea. (Selah) the special, holy dwelling place of the sovereign One. God rescues it at the break of dawn. God gives a shout, the earth dissolves. The God of Jacob is our protector! (Selah) who brings devastation to the earth! he shatters the bow and breaks the spear; he burns the shields with fire. I will be exalted over the nations! I will be exalted over the earth!' The God of Jacob is our protector! (Selah)
For this reason we do not fear when the earth shakes,
when its waves crash and foam,
The river"s channels bring joy to the city of God,
God lives within it, it cannot be moved.
Nations are in uproar, kingdoms are overthrown.
The Lord who commands armies is on our side!
Come! Witness the exploits of the Lord ,
He brings an end to wars throughout the earth;
He says, 'Stop your striving and recognize that I am God!
The Lord who commands armies is on our side!

47.verse_text: All you nations, clap your hands! Shout out to God in celebration! he is the great king who rules the whole earth! and countries under our feet. to be a source of pride for Jacob, whom he loves. (Selah) the Lord has ascended his throne amid the blaring of ram"s horns. Sing a well-written song! along with the people of the God of Abraham, for God has authority over the rulers of the earth. He is highly exalted!
For the sovereign Lord is awe-inspiring;
He picked out for us a special land
God has ascended his throne amid loud shouts;
Sing to God! Sing! Sing to our king! Sing! God sits on his holy throne!
For God is king of the whole earth!
The nobles of the nations assemble,

48.verse_text: The Lord is great and certainly worthy of praise in the city of our God, his holy hill. a source of joy to the whole earth. Mount Zion resembles the peaks of Zaphon; he reveals himself as its defender. they are terrified, they quickly retreat. like a woman writhing in childbirth. you shatter the large ships. in the city of the Lord , the invincible Warrior, God makes it permanently secure. (Selah) is worthy of your reputation, O God. You execute justice! the towns of Judah are happy, because of your acts of judgment. Walk through its fortresses, so you can tell the next generation about it! He guides us!
It is lofty and pleasing to look at, it is the city of the great king. they advance together. in the city of our God. within your temple. Count its towers!
As soon as they see, they are shocked;
We heard about God"s mighty deeds, now we have seen them,
We reflect on your loyal love, O God,
The praise you receive as far away as the ends of the earth
For God, our God, is our defender forever!

49.verse_text: Listen to this, all you nations! Pay attention, all you inhabitants of the world! I will share my profound thoughts. I will then sing my insightful song to the accompaniment of a harp. when the sinful deeds of deceptive men threaten to overwhelm me? and boast in their great riches. he cannot pay God an adequate ransom price and people go to their final destiny), and not experience death. fools and spiritually insensitive people all pass away and leave their wealth to others. their eternal dwelling place. They name their lands after themselves, they are like animals that perish. and of those who approve of their philosophy. (Selah) with death as their shepherd. The godly will rule over them when the day of vindication dawns; Sheol will consume their bodies and they will no longer live in impressive houses. certainly he will pull me to safety. (Selah) and his wealth multiplies! his wealth will not follow him down into the grave. they will never again see the light of day. they are like animals that perish.
Pay attention, all you people, both rich and poor! 'May men praise you, for you have done well!'
I will declare a wise saying;
I will learn a song that imparts wisdom;
Why should I be afraid in times of trouble,
They trust in their wealth
Certainly a man cannot rescue his brother;
(the ransom price for a human life is too high,
so that he might continue to live forever
Surely one sees that even wise people die;
Their grave becomes their permanent residence,
but, despite their wealth, people do not last,
This is the destiny of fools,
They will travel to Sheol like sheep,
But God will rescue my life from the power of Sheol;
Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich
For he will take nothing with him when he dies;
He pronounces this blessing on himself while he is alive:
But he will join his ancestors;
Wealthy people do not understand;

50.verse_text: El, God, the Lord speaks, and summons the earth to come from the east and west. God comes in splendor. and all around him a storm rages. as well as the earth, so that he might judge his people. 'Assemble my covenant people before me, those who ratified a covenant with me by sacrifice!' for God is judge. (Selah) Listen Israel! I am accusing you! or because of your burnt sacrifices that you continually offer me. as well as the cattle that graze on a thousand hills. and the insects of the field are mine. Do I drink the blood of goats? Repay your vows to the sovereign One! I will deliver you, and you will honor me!' and talk about my covenant? and reject my words. you associate with men who are unfaithful to their wives. and use your tongue to deceive. you slander your own brother. so you thought I was exactly like you. But now I will condemn you and state my case against you! Otherwise I will rip you to shreds To whoever obeys my commands, I will reveal my power to deliver.'
From Zion, the most beautiful of all places,

Our God approaches and is not silent; consuming fire goes ahead of him 'Listen my people! I am speaking! I am God, your God! or goats from your sheepfolds. for the world and all it contains belong to me. 'How can you declare my commands, and no one will be able to rescue you.
He summons the heavens above,
He says:
The heavens declare his fairness,
He says:
I am not condemning you because of your sacrifices,
I do not need to take a bull from your household
For every wild animal in the forest belongs to me,
I keep track of every bird in the hills,
Even if I were hungry, I would not tell you,
Do I eat the flesh of bulls?
Present to God a thank-offering!
Pray to me when you are in trouble!
God says this to the evildoer:
For you hate instruction
When you see a thief, you join him;
You do damage with words,
You plot against your brother;
When you did these things, I was silent,
Carefully consider this, you who reject God!
Whoever presents a thank-offering honors me.

51.verse_text: Have mercy on me, O God, because of your loyal love! Because of your great compassion, wipe away my rebellious acts! Cleanse me of my sin! I am forever conscious of my sin. So you are just when you confront me; you are right when you condemn me. a sinner the moment my mother conceived me. you want me to possess wisdom. wash me and I will be whiter than snow. May the bones you crushed rejoice! Wipe away all my guilt! Renew a resolute spirit within me! Do not take your Holy Spirit away from me! Sustain me by giving me the desire to obey! and sinners will turn to you. Then my tongue will shout for joy because of your deliverance. Then my mouth will praise you. you do not desire a burnt sacrifice. O God, a humble and repentant heart you will not reject. Fortify the walls of Jerusalem! then bulls will be sacrificed on your altar.
For I am aware of my rebellious acts;
Against you – you above all – I have sinned; I have done what is evil in your sight.
Look, I was guilty of sin from birth,
Look, you desire integrity in the inner man;
Sprinkle me with water and I will be pure;
Grant me the ultimate joy of being forgiven!
Hide your face from my sins!
Create for me a pure heart, O God!
Let me again experience the joy of your deliverance!
Then I will teach rebels your merciful ways,
Rescue me from the guilt of murder, O God, the God who delivers me!
O Lord, give me the words!
Certainly you do not want a sacrifice, or else I would offer it;
The sacrifices God desires are a humble spirit –
Because you favor Zion, do what is good for her!
Then you will accept the proper sacrifices, burnt sacrifices and whole offerings;

52.verse_text: Why do you boast about your evil plans, O powerful man? God"s loyal love protects me all day long! it is as effective as a sharp razor, O deceiver. lies more than speaking the truth. (Selah) He will scoop you up and remove you from your home; and will mock the evildoer, saying: and was confident about his plans to destroy others.' I continually trust in God"s loyal love. I will rely on you, for your loyal followers know you are good.
Your tongue carries out your destructive plans;
You love evil more than good,
You love to use all the words that destroy, and the tongue that deceives. he will uproot you from the land of the living. (Selah) He trusted in his great wealth
Yet God will make you a permanent heap of ruins.
When the godly see this, they will be filled with awe,
'Look, here is the man who would not make God his protector!
But I am like a flourishing olive tree in the house of God;
I will continually thank you when you execute judgment;

53.verse_text: Fools say to themselves, 'There is no God.' They sin and commit evil deeds; none of them does what is right. to see if there is anyone who is wise and seeks God. they are all morally corrupt. None of them does what is right, even by things that do not normally cause fear. For God annihilates those who attack you. You are able to humiliate them because God has rejected them. When God restores the well-being of his people, may Jacob rejoice, may Israel be happy!
God looks down from heaven at the human race,
Everyone rejects God; not even one! those who devour my people as if they were eating bread, and do not call out to God.
All those who behave wickedly do not understand –
I wish the deliverance of Israel would come from Zion!

54.verse_text: O God, deliver me by your name! Vindicate me by your power! Pay attention to what I say! ruthless men, who do not respect God, seek my life. (Selah) The Lord is among those who support me. As a demonstration of your faithfulness, destroy them! and I triumph over my enemies.
O God, listen to my prayer!
May those who wait to ambush me be repaid for their evil!
With a freewill offering I will sacrifice to you! I will give thanks to your name, O Lord , for it is good!
Surely he rescues me from all trouble,

55.verse_text: Listen, O God, to my prayer! Do not ignore my appeal for mercy! I am so upset and distressed, I am beside myself, and because of how the wicked pressure me, for they hurl trouble down upon me the horrors of death overcome me. terror overwhelms me. from the strong wind and the gale.' Frustrate their plans! while wickedness and destruction are within it. violence and deceit do not depart from its public square. it is not one who hates me who arrogantly taunts me, my close friend in whom I confided. May they go down alive into Sheol! I will lament and moan, and he will hear me. even though they greatly outnumber me. will hear and humiliate them. (Selah) and do not fear God. he breaks his solemn promises to them. but he harbors animosity in his heart. but they are really like sharp swords. and he will sustain you. He will never allow the godly to be upended. Violent and deceitful people will not live even half a normal lifespan.
Pay attention to me and answer me!

because of what the enemy says, and angrily attack me. I would fly away and settle in a safe place! I will stay in the wilderness. (Selah) For I see violence and conflict in the city. or else I could bear it; or else I could hide from him. in God"s temple we would walk together among the crowd. For evil is in their dwelling place and in their midst. and the Lord will deliver me. They refuse to change, His words seem softer than oil, But as for me, I trust in you.
My heart beats violently within me;
Fear and panic overpower me;
I say, 'I wish I had wings like a dove!
Look, I will escape to a distant place;
I will hurry off to a place that is safe
Confuse them, O Lord!
Day and night they walk around on its walls,
Disaster is within it;
Indeed, it is not an enemy who insults me,
But it is you, a man like me,
We would share personal thoughts with each other;
May death destroy them!
As for me, I will call out to God,
During the evening, morning, and noontime
He will rescue me and protect me from those who attack me,
God, the one who has reigned as king from long ago,
He attacks his friends;
His words are as smooth as butter,
Throw your burden upon the Lord ,
But you, O God, will bring them down to the deep Pit.

56.verse_text: Have mercy on me, O God, for men are attacking me! All day long hostile enemies are tormenting me. Indeed, many are fighting against me, O Exalted One. What can mere men do to me? they make a habit of plotting my demise. they watch my every step, as they prepare to take my life. In your anger bring down the nations, O God! Put my tears in your leather container! Are they not recorded in your scroll? I know that God is on my side. in the Lord – I boast in his promise – What can mere men do to me? I will give you the thank-offerings you deserve, You keep my feet from stumbling, so that I might serve God as I enjoy life.
Those who anticipate my defeat attack me all day long.
When I am afraid, I trust in you. in God I trust, I am not afraid.
In God – I boast in his promise –
All day long they cause me trouble;
Because they are bent on violence, do not let them escape!
You keep track of my misery.
My enemies will turn back when I cry out to you for help;
In God – I boast in his promise –
in God I trust, I am not afraid.
I am obligated to fulfill the vows I made to you, O God;
when you deliver my life from death.

57.verse_text: Have mercy on me, O God! Have mercy on me! For in you I have taken shelter. In the shadow of your wings I take shelter to the God who vindicates me. from my enemies who hurl insults! (Selah) I lie down among those who want to devour me; whose tongues are a sharp sword. May your splendor cover the whole earth! I am discouraged. They have dug a pit for me. They will fall into it! (Selah) I will wake up at dawn! I will sing praises to you before foreigners! May your splendor cover the whole earth! until trouble passes. May God send his loyal love and faithfulness! men whose teeth are spears and arrows, I will sing and praise you! Awake, O stringed instrument and harp! and your faithfulness reaches the clouds.
I cry out for help to the sovereign God,
May he send help from heaven and deliver me
Rise up above the sky, O God!
They have prepared a net to trap me;
I am determined, O God! I am determined!
I will give you thanks before the nations, O Master!
For your loyal love extends beyond the sky,
Rise up above the sky, O God!

58.verse_text: Do you rulers really pronounce just decisions? Do you judge people fairly? you deal out violence in the earth. liars go astray as soon as they are born. like a deaf serpent that does not hear, Let them wither like grass! Let them be like stillborn babies that never see the sun! he will sweep it away along with both the raw and cooked meat. 'Yes indeed, the godly are rewarded! Yes indeed, there is a God who judges in the earth!'
No! You plan how to do what is unjust;
The wicked turn aside from birth;
Their venom is like that of a snake,
that does not respond to the magicians, or to a skilled snake-charmer. Smash the jawbones of the lions, O Lord ! they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.
O God, break the teeth in their mouths!
Let them disappear like water that flows away!
Let them be like a snail that melts away as it moves along!
Before the kindling is even placed under your pots,
The godly will rejoice when they see vengeance carried out;

59.verse_text: Deliver me from my enemies, my God! Protect me from those who attack me! Rescue me from violent men! powerful men stalk me, but not because I have rebelled or sinned, O Lord . Spring into action and help me! Take notice of me! rouse yourself and punish all the nations! they growl like a dog and prowl around outside the city. and openly threaten to kill me, for they say, you taunt all the nations. For God is my refuge. God will enable me to triumph over my enemies. because then my people might forget the lesson. O Lord who shields us! they growl like a dog and prowl around outside the city. they refuse to sleep until they are full. For you are my refuge and my place of shelter when I face trouble. For God is my refuge, the God who loves me.
For look, they wait to ambush me;
Though I have done nothing wrong, they are anxious to attack.

You, O Lord God, the invincible warrior, the God of Israel, Have no mercy on any treacherous evildoers! (Selah) 'Who hears?' Use your power to make them homeless vagabonds and then bring them down, So let them be trapped by their own pride and by the curses and lies they speak! Let them know that God rules in Jacob and to the ends of the earth! (Selah) I will praise your loyal love in the morning.
Look, they hurl insults at me
But you, O Lord , laugh in disgust at them;
You are my source of strength! I will wait for you!
The God who loves me will help me;
Do not strike them dead suddenly,
Angrily wipe them out! Wipe them out so they vanish!
They wander around looking for something to eat;
As for me, I will sing about your strength;
You are my source of strength! I will sing praises to you!

60.verse_text: O God, you have rejected us. You suddenly turned on us in your anger. Please restore us! Repair its breaches, for it is ready to fall. you have made us drink intoxicating wine. so that they might seek safety from the bow. (Selah) so that the ones you love may be safe. the Valley of Succoth I will measure off. as does Manasseh! Ephraim is my helmet, Judah my royal scepter. I will make Edom serve me. I will shout in triumph over Philistia.' Who will bring me to Edom? for any help men might offer is futile. he will trample down our enemies.
You made the earth quake; you split it open.
You have made your people experience hard times;
You have given your loyal followers a rallying flag,
Deliver by your power and answer me,
God has spoken in his sanctuary: 'I will triumph! I will parcel out Shechem; O God, you do not go into battle with our armies.
Who will lead me into the fortified city?
Have you not rejected us, O God?
Give us help against the enemy,
By God"s power we will conquer;

61.verse_text: O God, hear my cry for help! Pay attention to my prayer!

From the most remote place on earth I call out to you in my despair. Lead me up to an inaccessible rocky summit! a strong tower that protects me from the enemy. I will find shelter in the protection of your wings. (Selah) you grant me the reward that belongs to your loyal followers. Make his lifetime span several generations! Decree that your loyal love and faithfulness should protect him. as I fulfill my vows day after day.
I will be a permanent guest in your home;
For you, O God, hear my vows;
May he reign forever before God!
Then I will sing praises to your name continually,

62.verse_text: For God alone I patiently wait; he is the one who delivers me. He is my refuge; I will not be upended. All of you are murderers, as dangerous as a leaning wall or an unstable fence. They love to use deceit; but inwardly they utter curses. (Selah) For he is the one who gives me confidence. He is my refuge; I will not be upended. God is my strong protector and my shelter. Pour out your hearts before him! human beings are unreliable. all of them together are lighter than air. Do not put false confidence in what you can gain by robbery! If wealth increases, do not become attached to it! two principles I have heard: God is strong, For you repay men for what they do.
He alone is my protector and deliverer.
How long will you threaten a man?
They spend all their time planning how to bring him down. they pronounce blessings with their mouths, God is our shelter! (Selah) When they are weighed in the scales,
Patiently wait for God alone, my soul!
He alone is my protector and deliverer.
God delivers me and exalts me;
Trust in him at all times, you people!
Men are nothing but a mere breath;
Do not trust in what you can gain by oppression!
and you, O Lord, demonstrate loyal love.

63.verse_text: O God, you are my God! I long for you! My soul thirsts for you, in a dry and parched land where there is no water. and witnessed your power and splendor. in your name I will lift up my hands. My mouth joyfully praises you, under your wings I rejoice. but they will descend into the depths of the earth. their corpses will be eaten by jackals. everyone who takes oaths in his name will boast, for the mouths of those who speak lies will be shut up. my flesh yearns for you, my lips will praise you. and think about you during the nighttime hours. your right hand upholds me.
Yes, in the sanctuary I have seen you,
Because experiencing your loyal love is better than life itself,
For this reason I will praise you while I live;
As if with choice meat you satisfy my soul.
whenever I remember you on my bed,
Enemies seek to destroy my life,
Each one will be handed over to the sword;
But the king will rejoice in God;

64.verse_text: Listen to me, O God, as I offer my lament! Protect my life from the enemy"s terrifying attacks. from the crowd of evildoers. they aim their arrow, a slanderous charge, They shoot at him suddenly and are unafraid of retaliation. They plan how to hide snares, and boast, 'Who will see them?' they disguise a well-conceived plot. Man"s inner thoughts cannot be discovered. suddenly they will be wounded by an arrow. All who see them will shudder, They will proclaim what God has done, All the morally upright will boast.
Hide me from the plots of evil men,
They sharpen their tongues like a sword;
in order to shoot down the innocent in secluded places.
They encourage one another to carry out their evil deed.
But God will shoot at them;
Their slander will bring about their demise.
and all people will fear. and reflect on his deeds. and take shelter in him.
The godly will rejoice in the Lord

65.verse_text: Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion. Vows made to you are fulfilled. May we be satisfied with the good things of your house – and their roaring waves, and the valleys are covered with grain. They shout joyfully, yes, they sing.

You hear prayers; all people approach you. but you forgive our acts of rebellion. and allow to live in your palace courts. your holy palace. O God, our savior. All the ends of the earth trust in you, as well as those living across the wide seas. and demonstrated your strength. as well as the commotion made by the nations. you cause those living in the east and west to praise you. you make it rich and fertile with overflowing streams full of water. You provide grain for them, for you prepare the earth to yield its crops. and soak its plowed ground. With rain showers you soften its soil, and make its crops grow. and you leave abundance in your wake. and the hills are clothed with joy.
Our record of sins overwhelms me,
How blessed is the one whom you choose,
You answer our prayers by performing awesome acts of deliverance,
You created the mountains by your power,
Even those living in the most remote areas are awestruck by your acts;
You visit the earth and give it rain;
You crown the year with your good blessings,
The pastures in the wilderness glisten with moisture,
The meadows are clothed with sheep,

66.verse_text: Shout out praise to God, all the earth!

Sing praises about the majesty of his reputation! Give him the honor he deserves! Because of your great power your enemies cower in fear before you. His acts on behalf of people are awesome! they passed through the river on foot. Let us rejoice in him there! he watches the nations. Stubborn rebels should not exalt themselves. (Selah) Loudly proclaim his praise! you caused us to suffer. but you brought us out into a wide open place. and praised him with my tongue. for he did not reject my prayer or abandon his love for me!

Say to God: 'How awesome are your deeds! and sings praises to you! They sing praises to your name!' (Selah) and does not allow our feet to slip. you purified us like refined silver. we passed through fire and water, I will fulfill the vows I made to you, and my mouth spoke when I was in trouble. along with the smell of sacrificial rams. I will offer cattle and goats. (Selah) I will declare what he has done for me. the Lord would not have listened. he listened to my prayer.
All the earth worships you
Come and witness God"s exploits!
He turned the sea into dry land;
He rules by his power forever;
Praise our God, you nations!
He preserves our lives
For you, O God, tested us;
You led us into a trap;
You allowed men to ride over our heads;
I will enter your temple with burnt sacrifices;
which my lips uttered
I will offer up to you fattened animals as burnt sacrifices,
Come! Listen, all you who are loyal to God!
I cried out to him for help
If I had harbored sin in my heart,
However, God heard;
God deserves praise,

67.verse_text: May God show us his favor and bless us! May he smile on us! (Selah) all nations will know how you deliver your people. Let all the nations thank you! and govern the people living on earth. (Selah) Let all the nations thank you! Then all the ends of the earth will give him the honor he deserves.
Then those living on earth will know what you are like;
Let the nations thank you, O God!
Let foreigners rejoice and celebrate! For you execute justice among the nations, May God, our God, bless us!
Let the nations thank you, O God!

68.verse_text: God springs into action! His enemies scatter; As wax melts before fire, so the wicked are destroyed before God. they rejoice before God Rejoice before him! yes, the heavens pour down rain You sustain the oppressed with your good blessings, O God. the wings of the dove are covered with silver including even sinful rebels. the God who delivers us. (Selah) I will bring them back from the depths of the sea, along with the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali. O God, you who have acted on our behalf, demonstrate your power, Kings bring tribute to you. Sing praises to the Lord, (Selah) his sovereignty over Israel, his adversaries run from him. and are overcome with joy. Exalt the one who rides on the clouds! For the Lord is his name! and an advocate for widows. God rules from his holy palace. he frees prisoners and grants them prosperity. But sinful rebels live in the desert. when you march through the desert, (Selah) before God, the God of Sinai, before God, the God of Israel. When they are tired, you sustain them, many, many women spread the good news. The lovely lady of the house divides up the loot. and with glittering gold. let it snow on Zalmon! the mountain of Bashan is a mountain with many peaks. at the mountain where God has decided to live? Indeed the Lord will live there permanently! they number in the thousands. The Lord comes from Sinai in holy splendor. you have taken many captives. You receive tribute from men, Indeed the Lord God lives there! Day after day he carries our burden, the Lord , the sovereign Lord, can rescue from death. the hairy foreheads of those who persist in rebellion. 'I will retrieve them from Bashan, and your dogs may eat their portion of the enemies" corpses.' the processions of my God, my king, who marches along in holy splendor. musicians follow playing their stringed instruments, in the midst of young women playing tambourines. the Lord , in the assemblies of Israel! and the princes of Judah in their robes, and the nations that assemble like a herd of calves led by bulls! They humble themselves and offer gold and silver as tribute. God scatters the nations that like to do battle. Ethiopia voluntarily offers tribute to God. Look! He thunders loudly. and the power he reveals in the skies! It is the God of Israel who gives the people power and strength. God deserves praise!
As smoke is driven away by the wind, so you drive them away.
But the godly are happy;
Sing to God! Sing praises to his name!
He is a father to the fatherless
God settles those who have been deserted in their own homes;
O God, when you lead your people into battle,
the earth shakes,
O God, you cause abundant showers to fall on your chosen people.
for you live among them.
The Lord speaks;
Kings leading armies run away – they run away!
When you lie down among the sheepfolds,
When the sovereign judge scatters kings,
The mountain of Bashan is a towering mountain;
Why do you look with envy, O mountains with many peaks,
God has countless chariots;
You ascend on high,
The Lord deserves praise!
Our God is a God who delivers;
Indeed God strikes the heads of his enemies,
The Lord says,
so that your feet may stomp in their blood,
They see your processions, O God –
Singers walk in front;
In your large assemblies praise God,
There is little Benjamin, their ruler,
God has decreed that you will be powerful.
as you come out of your temple in Jerusalem!
Sound your battle cry against the wild beast of the reeds,
They come with red cloth from Egypt,
O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God!
to the one who rides through the sky from ancient times!
Acknowledge God"s power,
You are awe-inspiring, O God, as you emerge from your holy temple!

69.verse_text: Deliver me, O God, for the water has reached my neck. where there is no solid ground; I am in deep water, my throat is sore; my eyes grow tired of looking for my God. Those who want to destroy me, my enemies for no reason, outnumber me. They make me repay what I did not steal! my guilt is not hidden from you. O sovereign Lord and king! and am thoroughly disgraced. they act as if I were a foreigner. I endure the insults of those who insult you. which causes others to insult me. and they ridicule me. drunkards mock me in their songs. answer me with your faithful deliverance! Deliver me from those who hate me, Don"t let the pit devour me! for I am in trouble! Answer me right away! you can see all my enemies. I look for sympathy, but receive none, and to quench my thirst they give me vinegar to drink. May it be a snare for that group of friends! Make them shake violently! May your raging anger overtake them! their tents uninhabited! they spread the news about the suffering of those whom you punish. Do not vindicate them! Do not let their names be listed with the godly! O God, deliver and protect me! I will magnify him as I give him thanks! You who seek God, may you be encouraged! he does not despise his captive people. and his people will again live in them and possess Zion. and those who are loyal to him will live in it.
