87.verse_text: The Lord "s city is in the holy hills.
The Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwelling places of Jacob. O city of God. (Selah)
People say wonderful things about you,

I mention Rahab and Babylon to my followers. Here are Philistia and Tyre, along with Ethiopia. It is said of them, 'This one was born there.' 'Each one of these was born in her, and the sovereign One makes her secure.' 'This one was born there.' (Selah) all of them sing within your walls.
But it is said of Zion"s residents,
The Lord writes in the census book of the nations,
As for the singers, as well as the pipers –

88.verse_text: O Lord God who delivers me! By day I cry out like corpses lying in the grave, whom you remember no more, in the dark places, in the watery depths. and you overwhelm me with all your waves. (Selah) you make me an appalling sight to them. I call out to you, O Lord , all day long; in the morning my prayer confronts you. your terrors destroy me. and at night I pray before you. Pay attention to my cry for help! and I am ready to enter Sheol. I am like a helpless man, and who are cut off from your power. I am trapped and cannot get free. I spread out my hands in prayer to you. Do the departed spirits rise up and give you thanks? (Selah) or your faithfulness in the place of the dead? or your deliverance in the land of oblivion? and pay no attention to me? I have been subjected to your horrors and am numb with pain. they join forces and encircle me. those who know me leave me alone in the darkness.
For my life is filled with troubles
They treat me like those who descend into the grave.
You place me in the lowest regions of the pit,
Your anger bears down on me,
You cause those who know me to keep their distance;
My eyes grow weak because of oppression.
Do you accomplish amazing things for the dead?
Is your loyal love proclaimed in the grave,
Are your amazing deeds experienced in the dark region,
As for me, I cry out to you, O Lord ;
O Lord , why do you reject me,
I am oppressed and have been on the verge of death since my youth.
They surround me like water all day long;
You cause my friends and neighbors to keep their distance;

89.verse_text: I will sing continually about the Lord "s faithful deeds; to future generations I will proclaim your faithfulness. in the skies you set up your faithfulness.' and establish your throne throughout future generations."' (Selah) as well as your faithfulness in the angelic assembly. Who is like the Lord among the heavenly beings, and more awesome than all who surround him? When its waves surge, you calm them. You made the world and all it contains. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name. your right hand victorious. Loyal love and faithfulness characterize your rule. O Lord , they experience your favor. and are vindicated by your justice. By your favor we are victorious. our king to the Holy One of Israel. 'I have energized a warrior; I have raised up a young man from the people. With my holy oil I have anointed him as king. a violent oppressor will not be able to humiliate him. and by my name he will win victories. his right hand over the rivers. "You are my father, my God, and the protector who delivers me." and my covenant with him is secure. and make his throne as enduring as the skies above. their sin by inflicting them with bruises. nor be unfaithful to my promise. or go back on what I promised. I will never deceive David. His throne will endure before me, like the sun, his throne will endure like the skies.' (Selah) you are angry with your chosen king. you have thrown his crown to the ground. and have not sustained him in battle. and have knocked his throne to the ground. Will you remain hidden forever? Why do you make all people so mortal? or deliver his life from the power of Sheol. (Selah) the ones performed in accordance with your reliable oath to David? and of how I must bear so many insults from people! they insult your chosen king as they dog his footsteps. We agree! We agree!
For I say, 'Loyal love is permanently established;

The Lord said, 'I have made a covenant with my chosen one; I have made a promise on oath to David, my servant: Who is strong like you, O Lord ? Your faithfulness surrounds you. with your strong arm you scattered your enemies. your hand strong, and my arm will strengthen him. I will strike down those who hate him. the most exalted of the earth"s kings. and disobey my regulations, and do not keep my commandments, you have made his strongholds a heap of ruins. he has become an object of disdain to his neighbors. and all his enemies to rejoice. and have covered him with shame. (Selah) Will your anger continue to burn like fire?
"I will give you an eternal dynasty
O Lord , the heavens praise your amazing deeds,
For who in the skies can compare to the Lord ?
a God who is honored in the great angelic assembly,
O Lord , sovereign God!
You rule over the proud sea.
You crushed the Proud One and killed it;
The heavens belong to you, as does the earth.
You created the north and the south.
Your arm is powerful,
Equity and justice are the foundation of your throne.
How blessed are the people who worship you!
They rejoice in your name all day long,
For you give them splendor and strength.
For our shield belongs to the Lord ,
Then you spoke through a vision to your faithful followers and said:
I have discovered David, my servant.
My hand will support him,
No enemy will be able to exact tribute from him;
I will crush his enemies before him;
He will experience my faithfulness and loyal love,
I will place his hand over the sea,
He will call out to me,
I will appoint him to be my firstborn son,
I will always extend my loyal love to him,
I will give him an eternal dynasty,
If his sons reject my law
if they break my rules
I will punish their rebellion by beating them with a club,
But I will not remove my loyal love from him,
I will not break my covenant
Once and for all I have vowed by my own holiness,
His dynasty will last forever.
it will remain stable, like the moon,
But you have spurned and rejected him;
You have repudiated your covenant with your servant;
You have broken down all his walls;
All who pass by have robbed him;
You have allowed his adversaries to be victorious,
You turn back his sword from the adversary,
You have brought to an end his splendor,
You have cut short his youth,
How long, O Lord , will this last?
Take note of my brief lifespan!
No man can live on without experiencing death,
Where are your earlier faithful deeds, O Lord,
Take note, O Lord, of the way your servants are taunted,
Your enemies, O Lord , hurl insults;
The Lord deserves praise forevermore!

90.verse_text: O Lord, you have been our protector through all generations!

Even before the mountains came into existence, or you brought the world into being, you were the eternal God. or like one of the divisions of the nighttime. at evening time it withers and dries up. you even know about our hidden sins. the years of our lives pass quickly, like a sigh. or eighty, if one is especially strong. But even one"s best years are marred by trouble and oppression. Yes, they pass quickly and we fly away. Your raging fury causes people to fear you. so that we might live wisely. How long must this suffering last? Have pity on your servants! Then we will shout for joy and be happy all our days! in proportion to the years we have experienced trouble! May their sons see your majesty! Yes, make them successful!

You make mankind return to the dust, and say, 'Return, O people!' are like yesterday that quickly passes, In the morning they are like the grass that sprouts up; we are terrified by your wrath. Make our endeavors successful!
Yes, in your eyes a thousand years
You bring their lives to an end and they 'fall asleep.'
in the morning it glistens and sprouts up;
Yes, we are consumed by your anger;
You are aware of our sins;
Yes, throughout all our days we experience your raging fury;
The days of our lives add up to seventy years,
Who can really fathom the intensity of your anger?
So teach us to consider our mortality,
Turn back toward us, O Lord !
Satisfy us in the morning with your loyal love!
Make us happy in proportion to the days you have afflicted us,
May your servants see your work!
May our sovereign God extend his favor to us!

91.verse_text: As for you, the one who lives in the shelter of the sovereign One, and resides in the protective shadow of the mighty king – His faithfulness is like a shield or a protective wall. or the disease that comes at noon. it will not reach you. you will see the wicked paid back. my shelter, the sovereign One. no illness will come near your home. to protect you in all you do. so you will not slip and fall on a stone. I will protect him because he is loyal to me.

I say this about the Lord , my shelter and my stronghold, my God in whom I trust – and from the destructive plague. you will find safety under his wings. the arrow that flies by day, and a multitude on your right side, you will trample underfoot a young lion and a serpent. 'Because he is devoted to me, I will deliver him; I will be with him when he is in trouble; I will rescue him and bring him honor. and will let him see my salvation.
he will certainly rescue you from the snare of the hunter
He will shelter you with his wings;
You need not fear the terrors of the night,
the plague that comes in the darkness,
Though a thousand may fall beside you,
Certainly you will see it with your very own eyes –
For you have taken refuge in the Lord ,
For he will order his angels
They will lift you up in their hands,
You will subdue a lion and a snake;
When he calls out to me, I will answer him.
I will satisfy him with long life,

92.verse_text: It is fitting to thank the Lord , and to sing praises to your name, O sovereign One! I will sing for joy because of what you have done. Your plans are very intricate! the fool does not understand this. and all the evildoers glisten, it is so that they may be annihilated. Indeed, look at how your enemies perish! I am covered with fresh oil. I hear the defeated cries of the evil foes who attacked me. they grow high like a cedar in Lebanon. they are filled with vitality and have many leaves. is just and never unfair.

It is fitting to proclaim your loyal love in the morning, and your faithfulness during the night, to the accompaniment of the meditative tone of the harp. All the evildoers are scattered! they grow in the courts of our God.
to the accompaniment of a ten-stringed instrument and a lyre,
For you, O Lord , have made me happy by your work.
How great are your works, O Lord !
The spiritually insensitive do not recognize this;
When the wicked sprout up like grass,
But you, O Lord , reign forever!
Indeed, look at your enemies, O Lord !
You exalt my horn like that of a wild ox.
I gloat in triumph over those who tried to ambush me;
The godly grow like a palm tree;
They bear fruit even when they are old;
So they proclaim that the Lord , my protector,

93.verse_text: The Lord reigns! He is robed in majesty, the Lord is robed, Indeed, the world is established, it cannot be moved. the waves roar, and the mighty waves of the sea, he wears strength around his waist. you have always been king. the waves roar and crash. the Lord sits enthroned in majesty. Holiness aptly adorns your house, O Lord , forever.
Your throne has been secure from ancient times;
Above the sound of the surging water,
The rules you set down are completely reliable.

94.verse_text: O Lord , the God who avenges! O God who avenges, reveal your splendor! how long will the wicked celebrate? all the evildoers boast. they oppress the nation that belongs to you. and they murder the fatherless. the God of Jacob does not take notice of it.' Does the one who forms the human eye not see? peoples" thoughts are morally bankrupt. until the wicked are destroyed. he does not abandon the nation that belongs to him. and all the morally upright will be vindicated. Who will stand up for me against the evildoers? I would have laid down in the silence of death. your soothing touch makes me happy. those who make oppressive laws. and condemn to death the innocent. and my God will shelter me. He will destroy them because of their evil;

Rise up, O judge of the earth! Pay back the proud! You fools, when will you ever understand? He is the one who imparts knowledge to human beings! the one whom you teach from your law, your loyal love, O Lord , supports me. the Lord our God will destroy them.
O Lord , how long will the wicked,
They spew out threats and speak defiantly;
O Lord , they crush your people;
They kill the widow and the one residing outside his native land,
Then they say, 'The Lord does not see this;
Take notice of this, you ignorant people!
Does the one who makes the human ear not hear?
Does the one who disciplines the nations not punish?
The Lord knows that
How blessed is the one whom you instruct, O Lord ,
in order to protect him from times of trouble,
Certainly the Lord does not forsake his people;
For justice will prevail,
Who will rise up to defend me against the wicked?
If the Lord had not helped me,
If I say, 'My foot is slipping,'
When worries threaten to overwhelm me,
Cruel rulers are not your allies,
They conspire against the blameless,
But the Lord will protect me,
He will pay them back for their sin.

95.verse_text: Come! Let"s sing for joy to the Lord ! Let"s shout out praises to our protector who delivers us! Let"s shout out to him in celebration! a great king who is superior to all gods. the sheep he owns. Today, if only you would obey him! like they were that day at Massah in the wilderness, and I said, "These people desire to go astray; they do not obey my commands." "They will never enter into the resting place I had set aside for them."'
Let"s enter his presence with thanksgiving!
For the Lord is a great God,

The depths of the earth are in his hand, and the mountain peaks belong to him. His hands formed the dry land. Let"s kneel before the Lord , our creator! we are the people of his pasture, and tried my patience, even though they had seen my work.
The sea is his, for he made it.
Come! Let"s bow down and worship!
He says, 'Do not be stubborn like they were at Meribah,
where your ancestors challenged my authority,
For forty years I was continually disgusted with that generation,
So I made a vow in my anger,

96.verse_text: Sing to the Lord a new song! Sing to the Lord , all the earth! but the Lord made the sky. ascribe to the Lord splendor and strength! Bring an offering and enter his courts! Tremble before him, all the earth! The world is established, it cannot be moved. He judges the nations fairly.' Let the sea and everything in it shout! Then let the trees of the forest shout with joy For he comes to judge the earth!

Sing to the Lord ! Praise his name! Announce every day how he delivers! Tell all the nations about his amazing deeds! he is more awesome than all gods. his sanctuary is firmly established and beautiful. He judges the world fairly, and the nations in accordance with his justice.
Tell the nations about his splendor!
For the Lord is great and certainly worthy of praise;
For all the gods of the nations are worthless,
Ascribe to the Lord , O families of the nations,
Ascribe to the Lord the splendor he deserves!
Worship the Lord in holy attire!
Say among the nations, 'The Lord reigns!
Let the sky rejoice, and the earth be happy!
Let the fields and everything in them celebrate!
before the Lord , for he comes!

97.verse_text: The Lord reigns! Let the earth be happy! Let the many coastlands rejoice! the earth sees and trembles. before the Lord of the whole earth. and all the nations see his splendor. those who boast about worthless idols. because of your judgments, O Lord . you are elevated high above all gods.

Dark clouds surround him; equity and justice are the foundation of his throne. on every side it burns up his enemies. All the gods bow down before him. the towns of Judah are happy, He protects the lives of his faithful followers; he delivers them from the power of the wicked. the morally upright experience joy. Give thanks to his holy name.
His lightning bolts light up the world;
The mountains melt like wax before the Lord ,
All who worship idols are ashamed,
For you, O Lord , are the sovereign king over the whole earth;
You who love the Lord , hate evil!
The godly bask in the light;
You godly ones, rejoice in the Lord !

98.verse_text: Sing to the Lord a new song, for he performs amazing deeds! accomplish deliverance. All the ends of the earth see our God deliver us. He judges the world fairly, His right hand and his mighty arm in the sight of the nations he reveals his justice. Break out in a joyful shout and sing! accompanied by a harp and the sound of music! shout out praises before the king, the Lord ! along with the world and those who live in it! Let the mountains sing in unison For he comes to judge the earth! and the nations in a just manner.
The Lord demonstrates his power to deliver;
He remains loyal and faithful to the family of Israel.
Shout out praises to the Lord , all the earth!
Sing to the Lord accompanied by a harp,
With trumpets and the blaring of the ram"s horn,
Let the sea and everything in it shout,
Let the rivers clap their hands!

99.verse_text: The Lord reigns! The nations tremble. He sits enthroned above the winged angels; the earth shakes. He is holy! he loves justice. You ensure that legal decisions will be made fairly; Worship before his footstool! Samuel was one of those who prayed to him. They prayed to the Lord and he answered them. but also one who punished their sinful deeds.

The Lord is elevated in Zion; he is exalted over all the nations. you promote justice and equity in Jacob. He is holy! they obeyed his regulations and the ordinance he gave them. They found you to be a forgiving God, Worship on his holy hill, for the Lord our God is holy!
Let them praise your great and awesome name!
Moses and Aaron were among his priests;
He spoke to them from a pillar of cloud;
O Lord our God, you answered them.

100.verse_text: Shout out praises to the Lord , all the earth!
Worship the Lord with joy! Enter his presence with joyful singing! we are his people, the sheep of his pasture. and his courts with praise! Give him thanks! Praise his name!
Acknowledge that the Lord is God! He made us and we belong to him; His loyal love endures, and he is faithful through all generations.

101.verse_text: I will sing about loyalty and justice! To you, O Lord , I will sing praises! When will you come to me? and remove all evildoers from the city of the Lord .

I will walk in the way of integrity. I will conduct my business with integrity in the midst of my palace. I hate doing evil; I will have no part of it. I will not permit evil. I will not tolerate anyone who has a cocky demeanor and an arrogant attitude. and allow them to live with me. Those who walk in the way of integrity will attend me. Liars will not be welcome in my presence.
I will not even consider doing what is dishonest.
I will have nothing to do with a perverse person;
I will destroy anyone who slanders his neighbor in secret.
I will favor the honest people of the land,
Deceitful people will not live in my palace.
Each morning I will destroy all the wicked people in the land,

102.verse_text: O Lord , hear my prayer! Pay attention to my cry for help! Listen to me! and my bones are charred like a fireplace. for I am unable to eat food. my bones protrude from my skin. I am like a screech owl among the ruins. those who mock me use my name in their curses. and mix my drink with my tears, Indeed, you pick me up and throw me away. and your reputation endures. and feel compassion for the dust of her ruins. and all the kings of the earth will respect his splendor, and does not reject their request. from heaven the Lord will look toward earth, and to set free those condemned to die, and praise him in Jerusalem, and the kingdoms pay tribute to the Lord . You endure through all generations. but you will endure. like clothes you will remove them and they will disappear. and their descendants will live securely in your presence.'

Do not ignore me in my time of trouble! When I call out to you, quickly answer me! I am like a solitary bird on a roof. and I am withered like grass. For it is time to have mercy on her, for the appointed time has come. and reveals his splendor, people yet to be born will praise the Lord . he has cut short my days. the skies are your handiwork. They will wear out like a garment; your years do not come to an end.
For my days go up in smoke,
My heart is parched and withered like grass,
Because of the anxiety that makes me groan,
I am like an owl in the wilderness;
I stay awake;
All day long my enemies taunt me;
For I eat ashes as if they were bread,
because of your anger and raging fury.
My days are coming to an end,
But you, O Lord , rule forever,
You will rise up and have compassion on Zion.
Indeed, your servants take delight in her stones,
The nations will respect the reputation of the Lord ,
when the Lord rebuilds Zion,
when he responds to the prayer of the destitute,
The account of his intervention will be recorded for future generations;
For he will look down from his sanctuary above;
in order to hear the painful cries of the prisoners,
so they may proclaim the name of the Lord in Zion,
when the nations gather together,
He has taken away my strength in the middle of life;
I say, 'O my God, please do not take me away in the middle of my life!
In earlier times you established the earth;
They will perish,
But you remain;
The children of your servants will settle down here,

103.verse_text: Praise the Lord , O my soul! With all that is within me, praise his holy name! Do not forget all his kind deeds! who heals all your diseases, so your youth is renewed like an eagle"s. and executes justice for all the oppressed. he is patient and demonstrates great loyal love. and does not stay angry. he does not repay us as our misdeeds deserve. so his loyal love towers over his faithful followers. so he removes the guilt of our rebellious actions from us. so the Lord has compassion on his faithful followers. he realizes we are made of clay. and is faithful to their descendants, who are careful to obey his commands. his kingdom extends over everything. and obey his orders! you servants of his who carry out his desires! in all the regions of his kingdom!
Praise the Lord , O my soul!
He is the one who forgives all your sins,

who delivers your life from the Pit, who crowns you with his loyal love and compassion, his deeds to the Israelites. Like a flower in the field it flourishes, and one can no longer even spot the place where it once grew. you powerful warriors who carry out his decrees Praise the Lord , O my soul!
who satisfies your life with good things,
The Lord does what is fair,
The Lord revealed his faithful acts to Moses,
The Lord is compassionate and merciful;
He does not always accuse,
He does not deal with us as our sins deserve;
For as the skies are high above the earth,
As far as the eastern horizon is from the west,
As a father has compassion on his children,
For he knows what we are made of;
A person"s life is like grass.
but when the hot wind blows by, it disappears,
But the Lord continually shows loyal love to his faithful followers,
to those who keep his covenant,
The Lord has established his throne in heaven;
Praise the Lord , you angels of his,
Praise the Lord , all you warriors of his,
Praise the Lord , all that he has made,

104.verse_text: Praise the Lord , O my soul! O Lord my God, you are magnificent. and travels along on the wings of the wind. and the flaming fire his attendant. the waters reached above the mountains. to the place you appointed for them. so that they would not cover the earth again. they chirp among the bushes. the earth is full of the fruit you cause to grow. and crops for people to cultivate, so they can produce food from the ground, and so they can have oil to make their faces shine, as well as food that sustains people"s lives. near the evergreens in which the herons live. and the sun sets according to a regular schedule. seeking their food from God. and sleep in their dens. and labor away until evening. You have exhibited great skill in making all of them; which teems with innumerable swimming creatures, and over here swims the whale you made to play in it. to provide them with food on a regular basis. you open your hand and they are filled with food. May the Lord find pleasure in the living things he has made! I will sing praise to my God as long as I exist! You are robed in splendor and majesty. He stretches out the skies like a tent curtain, He makes the clouds his chariot, it will never be upended. at the sound of your thunderous voice they hurried off – and the valleys went down – they flow between the mountains. the wild donkeys quench their thirst. the cedars of Lebanon which he planted, the rock badgers find safety in the cliffs. during which all the beasts of the forest prowl around. the earth is full of the living things you have made. living things both small and large. When you take away their life"s breath, they die and return to dust. and you replenish the surface of the ground. he touches the mountains and they start to smolder. I will rejoice in the Lord . and the wicked vanish! Praise the Lord , O my soul! Praise the Lord !
He covers himself with light as if it were a garment.
and lays the beams of the upper rooms of his palace on the rain clouds.
He makes the winds his messengers,
He established the earth on its foundations;
The watery deep covered it like a garment;
Your shout made the waters retreat;
as the mountains rose up,
You set up a boundary for them that they could not cross,
He turns springs into streams;
They provide water for all the animals in the field;
The birds of the sky live beside them;
He waters the mountains from the upper rooms of his palace;
He provides grass for the cattle,
as well as wine that makes people feel so good,
The trees of the Lord receive all the rain they need,
where the birds make nests,
The wild goats live in the high mountains;
He made the moon to mark the months,
You make it dark and night comes,
The lions roar for prey,
When the sun rises, they withdraw
Men then go out to do their work,
How many living things you have made, O Lord !
Over here is the deep, wide sea,
The ships travel there,
All of your creatures wait for you
You give food to them and they receive it;
When you ignore them, they panic.
When you send your life-giving breath, they are created,
May the splendor of the Lord endure!
He looks down on the earth and it shakes;
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
May my thoughts be pleasing to him!
May sinners disappear from the earth,

105.verse_text: Give thanks to the Lord ! Call on his name! Make known his accomplishments among the nations! Make music to him! Tell about all his miraculous deeds! Let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice! Seek his presence continually! the promise he made by oath to Isaac! as the portion of your inheritance.' just a very few, and resident aliens within it, he disciplined kings for their sake, Don"t harm my prophets!' Joseph was sold as a servant. the ruler of nations set him free. and made him manager of all his property, and Aaron, whom he had chosen. and his amazing deeds in the land of Ham. and killed their fish. which even got into the rooms of their kings. gnats invaded their whole territory. and broke the trees throughout their territory. innumerable grasshoppers. none of his tribes stumbled. and provided a fire to light up the night. a river ran through dry regions. he made to Abraham his servant. Praise the Lord !
Sing to him!
Boast about his holy name!
Seek the Lord and the strength he gives!

Recall the miraculous deeds he performed, his mighty acts and the judgments he decreed, you descendants of Jacob, God"s chosen ones! he carries out judgment throughout the earth. the promise he made to a thousand generations – to Israel as a lasting promise, and from one kingdom to another. he cut off all the food supply. his neck was placed in an iron collar, The Lord "s word proved him right. and to teach his advisers. Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham. and made them more numerous than their enemies. and to mistreat his servants. they did not disobey his orders. there was lightning in their land. and devoured the crops of their fields. the firstfruits of their reproductive power. for they were afraid of them. he satisfied them with food from the sky. his chosen ones shouted with joy. and they took possession of what other peoples had produced, and obey his laws.
O children of Abraham, God"s servant,
He is the Lord our God;
He always remembers his covenantal decree,
the promise he made to Abraham,
He gave it to Jacob as a decree,
saying, 'To you I will give the land of Canaan
When they were few in number,
they wandered from nation to nation,
He let no one oppress them;
saying, 'Don"t touch my chosen ones!
He called down a famine upon the earth;
He sent a man ahead of them –
The shackles hurt his feet;
until the time when his prediction came true.
The king authorized his release;
He put him in charge of his palace,
giving him authority to imprison his officials
Israel moved to Egypt;
The Lord made his people very fruitful,
He caused them to hate his people,
He sent his servant Moses,
They executed his miraculous signs among them,
He made it dark;
He turned their water into blood,
Their land was overrun by frogs,
He ordered flies to come;
He sent hail along with the rain;
He destroyed their vines and fig trees,
He ordered locusts to come,
They ate all the vegetation in their land,
He struck down all the firstborn in their land,
He brought his people out enriched with silver and gold;
Egypt was happy when they left,
He spread out a cloud for a cover,
They asked for food, and he sent quails;
He opened up a rock and water flowed out;
Yes, he remembered the sacred promise
When he led his people out, they rejoiced;
He handed the territory of nations over to them,
so that they might keep his commands

106.verse_text: Praise the Lord ! Give thanks to the Lord , for he is good, and do what is right all the time! Pay attention to me, when you deliver, we have done wrong, we have done evil. they failed to remember your many acts of loyal love, that he might reveal his power. he led them through the deep water as if it were a desert. they sang praises to him. and worshiped a metal idol. for the image of an ox that eats grass. the one who performed great deeds in Egypt, and a plague broke out among them. and the plague subsided. as the Lord had commanded them to do. the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan. and those who hated them ruled over them. when he heard their cry for help. to have pity on them.
